shareTitle: Lend a hand and share the app!

intro.title:
Welcome to COVI
The app against Covid-19
intro.subtitle: COVI empowers you to protect yourself and help limit the spread of the virus.
intro.slide2Text: Create your profile and self-assess any symptoms.
intro.slide3Text: Check your dashboard daily for personalized recommendations.
intro.slide4Text: Get notified if you might have been exposed to the virus so you can self-isolate or get tested.

introPrivacy.title: Your privacy and rights are protected
introPrivacy.text: Your data is protected, stored in Canada, deleted regularly and only used for the fight against Covid-19.
introPrivacy.touAndPP: COVI needs your agreement to the
introPrivacy.touAndPPLink: Terms and conditions and Privacy Policy.

consent.barrierLabel: How is your data collected, used and disclosed?
consent.dialogTitle: How is your data collected, used and disclosed?
consent.dialogSubtitle: To give you the best recommendations, the app stores locally on your phone the following:
consent.infoDesc4: - Coarse geographical location and movement statistics
consent.riskScoreContent: Your profile, symptoms and test results allow the app to estimate a daily personal risk level of being infected with Covid-19. By using this app, you agree to share this risk score with other users you interact with. This information does not directly identify you and is encrypted to protect your privacy. The app uses this score to adjust the personal risk levels of other users to help limit the spread of the virus.
consent.analyticsContent: COVI accesses non-sensitive analytics information about your use of the app to help improve how the app works.
consent.title: Customize your privacy settings. At any time, you can adjust these permissions in-app or erase your data.
consent.anonymousCardText: To keep your experience personalized and updated—privately and securely.
consent.bluetoothCardText: To monitor your potential exposure through community-based tracing.
consent.pushNotificationCardText: To notify you when you have new tips or if your profile is out of date.
consent.termsAndConditionsPreface: To work, COVI needs your consent to the

permissions.title:
Location services: To enable COVI to do its work, press “Always Allow”.

Push notifications: select  “Allow”
permissions.error: For COVI to be able to do its work, you must enable the required permissions.

dataShare.title: Help COVI learn more about Covid-19
dataShare.subtitle: By providing information you are helping COVI Canada improve its recommendations and also aiding public health authorities prevent future outbreaks by understanding where and how the virus is spreading. Your privacy will be protected.
dataShare.switchLabel: I consent to sharing my data to COVI Canada.
dataShare.deleteWhenYouWant: You can withdraw your consent or erase your data at any point in the app settings.
dataShare.privacySpeech: Your privacy is important to us.
dataShare.privacyButton: Learn about how we're protecting it.

modal.barrierLabel: How will COVI Canada collect, use and disclose this data?
modal.dialogTitle: How will COVI Canada collect, use and disclose this data?
modal.nonIdentifyingContent: Your profile information, health conditions, symptoms, risk level, coarse geographical location and movement statistics, positive test result and app analytics will be sent to COVI Canada to understand the spread of the virus and assess personal risk. This information does not directly identify you and is encrypted to protect your privacy.
modal.aggregateDataContent: Statistics will be shared with public health authorities or other entities to support our fight against Covid-19.

preDashboard.subtitle: COVI is ready to start providing you personalized recommendations.

news.example:
It's the end of the first week back to school! Take your time to relax and spend time with your family.

Keep in mind that the earlier you prepare your child for school re-opening, the easier it will be for him. It is recommended to return to a regular schedule at least one week before.

poll.question: Are you always wearing a mask when going outside?

C008.label: Learn More

R001.title: Call 911
R001.content:
Please call 911 or go directly to your nearest ER.

These symptoms require immediate attention.

R002.title: Call a healthcare professional
R002.content:
Consult a healthcare professional or call Telehealth:

  • If you are in Alberta, British Columbia, Newfoundland and Labrador, New Brunswick, Nova Scotia, Prince Edward Island, Québec, Saskatchewan, or the Yukon, call 811.
  • For Manitoba, call 204-788-8200 in Winnipeg or 1-888-315-9257 toll-free.
  • For the Northwest Territories, visit the Government of the Northwest Territories site here.
  • For Nunavut, call your local health care provider.
  • For Ontario, call 1-866-797-0000.
R002.explanation: You have reported symptoms consistent with Covid-19.

R003.title: Quarantine for 14 days
R003.content:
You can protect yourself and others by staying home for 14 days.

  • Only go out if you need medical care.
  • Arrange to have groceries and supplies dropped off at your door to minimize contact with others.
  • This quarantine is mandatoryif you have traveled in the last 14 days.
R003.explanation: You may have been exposed to Covid-19 because you had contact with someone who is infected and/or you travelled outside Canada in the last 14 days.

R004.title: Isolate to protect others
R004.content:
Stay at home and isolate:

  • Only go out if you need medical care.
  • Do not use public transportation.
  • Arrange to have groceries and supplies dropped off at your door to minimize contact with others.
R004.explanation: You have reported symptoms consistent with Covid-19.

R005.title: Isolate to protect yourself
R005.content:
To protect yourself, stay at home and stay away from others. This means:

  • Do not leave home unless it’s to seek medical care.
  • Arrange to have groceries and supplies dropped off at your door to minimize contact with other people.
R005.explanation: You are considered at higher risk since you are 60 or older.

R006.title: Keep those in your home safe
R006.content:
• Do not receive visitors in your home.
  • Remain alone in one room of the house as often as possible and close the door.
  • Eat and sleep alone in one room of the house.
  • If possible, use a bathroom reserved for your sole use. If not possible, disinfect it after each use.
  • Avoid contact with other people in the home as much as possible. Wear a mask if you can. Stay at least 2 metres away from others if not wearing a mask.
  • Use disposable tissues to cough, blow your nose, or sneeze.
  • Discard the tissues in the garbage and wash your hands with soap and water for 20 seconds.
R006.explanation: You have reported symptoms consistent with Covid-19.

R007.title: Protect the most vulnerable
R007.content: Avoid contact with individuals with chronic conditions (diabetes, heart disease, lung disease), compromised immune systems and older adults (60 years or more).

R008.title: Self-assess your symptoms
R008.content:
Use the self-assessment tool each time your symptoms change. Call 911 immediately if your symptoms are severe.

Please do not go to an ER, family doctor, or walk-in clinic unless your symptoms are severe. If you do need to visit these facilities, please call ahead to disclose: your symptoms, any international travel within the last 14 days and if you have had close contact with a possible or confirmed case of COVID-19.
R008.explanation: You have reported symptoms consistent with Covid-19.

R009.title: Call your supervisor or your local health authorities
R009.content: As a healthcare worker, you are on the front lines of our efforts against Covid-19. To keep yourself and others safe, please call your supervisor for additional direction and guidance.
R009.explanation: You are a healthcare professional with symptoms or fall under an isolation or quarantine recommendation.

R010.title: Stay home
R010.content:
The majority of Canadians are following the guidelines below. In order to protect others:

  • Only leave home for essentials.
  • Stay home unless you have to go to work.
  • Talk to your employer about working from home, if possible.

R011.title: Practice good hygiene
R011.content:
Proper hygiene reduces the spread of the virus:

  • Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds, especially when returning home or after touching shared surfaces like faucets, keyboards or doorknobs.
  • Use alcohol-based hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol if soap and water are not available.
  • Cough or sneeze into a tissue or your elbow.
  • Throw tissues into the garbage right away and wash your hands afterwards.
  • Avoid touching your eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands.

R012.title: Practice physical (social) distancing
R012.content:
The majority of people are practicing physical (social) distancing. Even if you don't have symptoms of Covid-19, you should stay at home as much as possible.

  • Talk to your employer about working from home if possible.
  • Avoid all non-essential trips.
  • Do not gather in groups.
  • Limit contact with people at higher risk (e.g. older adults and those in poor health).
  • Always keep a distance of at least 2 meters, or approximately 2 arms lengths, from others if you leave your house.
  • Wear a mask, when physical (social) distancing is difficult.
  • People you live with do not need to distance from each other unless they are sick or have travelled in the last 14 days.

R013.title: Go for a walk
R013.content:
Taking walks can benefit your physical and mental health. You can go for a walk if you:

  • Have not been diagnosed with Covid-19.
  • Do not have symptoms of Covid-19.
  • Have not travelled outside of Canada in the past 14 days.

If you go out for a walk, do not get close to others. Always practice physical (social) distancing by keeping at least two arm lengths apart from others at all times.

R014.title: Self-assess if your symptoms change
R014.content:
Use the self-assessment tool whenever you feel your symptoms change.Call 911 right away if you have any of the following symptoms:

  • Severe difficulty breathing
  • Chest pain
  • A hard time waking up
  • Feelings of confusion
  • Loss of consciousness

It is not necessary to go to an emergency department, family doctor or walk-in clinic unless your symptoms become severe.

If you do need to visit one of these places, please call ahead and tell them about:

  • your symptoms
  • any international travel within 14 days
  • whether you have had close contact with a possible or confirmed case of Covid-19.

WR001.title: Take some time to relax
WR001.content: Take some time to enjoy the little pleasures of life, like listening to music, reading or doing other fun activities from the comfort of your home.

WR002.title: Stay connected to others
WR002.content: Keeping up social connections is important during stressful, isolating times. Stay connected with your friends and family by calling, texting or organizing a video chat with them.

testResult.title: Test results
testResult.subtitle: Sharing your results helps protect others by updating their personal risk level and recommendations.
testResult.question: My test result was
testResult.acknowledgmentEnd: for Covid-19 at an official testing centre.
testResult.shareLabel: I wish to share my results with the app to help protect others and limit the spread of the virus.

selfDiagnostic.title: How are you feeling?
selfDiagnostic.subtitle: The app can help you decide what to do if you are experiencing symptoms.
selfDiagnostic.stillSymptomsTitle: Are you still experiencing these symptoms?
selfDiagnostic.stillSymptomsSubtitle: By unchecking a symptom, you are indicating that you are no longer experiencing that symptom.
selfDiagnostic.symptomsLabel: Are you experiencing any new symptoms?
selfDiagnostic.newSymptomsTitle: Which new symptoms are you experiencing?
selfDiagnostic.newSymptomsSubtitle: By checking a symptom, you are indicating that you are experiencing it.
selfDiagnostic.lightChoiceDescription: I can still do my regular activities.
selfDiagnostic.moderateChoiceDescription: I cannot do my regular activities, manage a chronic health condition, or cannot lie down because of difficulty breathing
selfDiagnostic.heavyChoiceDescription: I cannot finish a sentence without stopping.
selfDiagnostic.hardTimeWakingUp: Having a hard time waking up

healthCheck.title: Health check
healthCheck.subtitle: Take a moment to answer some questions to personalize your recommendations.
healthCheck.formTitle: Is your information up to date?

additionnalQuestions.title: Daily life
additionnalQuestions.subtitle: Understanding your daily life helps the app adjust your risk level and recommendations
additionnalQuestions.atWorkContact: At work, you come into contact with:
additionnalQuestions.hasHouseholdContact: People only in your household (e.g. you work from home)
additionnalQuestions.hasFewPeopleContact: A few people, mostly the same (e.g. you work in a small office)
additionnalQuestions.hasManyPeopleContact: Many different people (e.g. you work in a large office or as a clerk, in a restaurant or in delivery)
additionnalQuestions.wearMaskAtWork: Do you wear a mask at work?
additionnalQuestions.workWithProtectiveScreen: Do you work behind a protective screen (e.g. glass, plexiglass)?
additionnalQuestions.washingHandsOutside: Do you regularly wash your hands or use hand sanitizer when you are outside of your home?
additionnalQuestions.washHandsReturningHome: Do you wash your hands or use hand sanitizer when returning home and/or after coming in contact with people outside your household?
additionnalQuestions.lastPublicTransportation: When was the last time you used public transit?
additionnalQuestions.typeOfPublicTransportation: What type of public transportation did you use? (e.g. bus, taxi, train, subway)
additionnalQuestions.taxiRideSharing: Taxi and/or ridesharing (Uber, Lyft, Eva, etc.)
additionnalQuestions.timeUsingPublicTransit: How many times did you use public transport in the last 7 days? (A round trip counts as two times).

getTested.title: Get tested for Covid-19
getTested.subtitle: Your symptoms are consistent with Covid-19 or siCOVIr illness. Get tested now.
getTested.explanations: If your symptoms get worse, contact your healthcare provider or public health authority right away and follow their instructions.
getTested.governmentWebsiteLink: Visit the Government website to know where to call
